merged.Arthritis: Caused by immune-mediated inflammation of synovial joints, mimicking autoimmune arthritis.
merged.Colitis: Results from immune-mediated inflammation of the gastrointestinal tract, primarily the colon, due to dysregulation of immune checkpoints.
merged.Dermatitis: Results from immune-mediated attack on skin cells, leading to inflammation and altered skin integrity.
merged.Endocrinopathies: Caused by immune attack on endocrine glands such as the thyroid, adrenal, or pancreas, disrupting hormonal balance.
merged.Hemolytic Anemia: Develops due to immune-mediated destruction of red blood cells, often involving autoantibodies.
merged.Hepatitis: Occurs when immune activation targets hepatocytes, leading to liver inflammation and dysfunction.
merged.Lymphocytic Hypophysitis: Triggered by immune infiltration and inflammation of the pituitary gland, disrupting hormonal regulation.
merged.Myocarditis: Triggered by immune infiltration and inflammation of cardiac myocytes, disrupting heart function.
merged.Nephritis: Develops due to immune-mediated damage to renal tissues, often affecting glomeruli or tubules.
merged.Neurological Toxicities: Arises from immune system targeting of neural tissue, affecting the central or peripheral nervous system.
merged.Pancreatitis: Occurs when immune activation targets pancreatic tissue, leading to inflammation and enzyme dysregulation.
merged.Pneumonitis: Caused by immune-mediated inflammation of lung tissue due to an overactive immune response targeting pulmonary cells.
merged.Thrombocytopenia: Caused by immune destruction of platelets or suppression of their production in the bone marrow.
merged.Uveitis: Results from immune-mediated inflammation of the uveal tract in the eye, impairing visual function.
